wikipedia_page.main: Harold Franks (1891 – 1973) was a British light heavyweight professional boxer who competed in the 1920s. He won a bronze medal in Boxing at the 1920 Summer Olympics losing against Norwegian boxer Sverre Sorsdal in the semi-finals.Franks won the inaugural Amateur Boxing Association 1920 light heavyweight title, when boxing out of the St. Pancras ABC.

link_mentions.page: Great Britain at the 1920 Summer Olympics

response: Hugh Brown (born 2 February 1894, date of death unknown) was a British boxer who competed in the 1920 Summer Olympics. In 1920 he finished fourth in the light heavyweight class after losing the bronze medal bout to Harold Franks.

Louis Piochelle (12 December 1888 – 15 September 1939) was a French boxer who competed in the 1920 Summer Olympics. In 1920, he was eliminated in the quarter-finals of the light heavyweight class after losing his fight to Harold Franks.
